channel.title: reasoning on frieda rong
channel.description: Recent content in reasoning on frieda rong

item.title: Benchmarking and evaluation frameworks for reasoning in language models
item.description: A version of the talk given to DGP catered towards self-driving cars.

item.title: Evaluating artificial intelligence (AI) and human reasoning
item.description: A summary presentation of my work on evaluating reasoning across mathematics, creative writing, video games, and card games.

item.title: Characterizing Learning Progress of Problem-Solvers Using Puzzle-Solving Log Data
item.description: Demo paper at EDM 2023. How do human learners perform on a puzzle video game compared to AI learners?

item.title: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models
item.description: †: lead authors *: major contributors endpreamble Accepted to TMLR 2023. How well do large language models perform on the MATH dataset?

item.title: Factor Analysis for Baba is AI
item.description: A tutorial for education and machine learning researchers on using factor analysis to analyze data for an in-progress research project.

item.title: Baba is AI
item.description: A project presentation for the 2022 class of CSLI summer interns on studying the problem-solving process in the video game Baba is You.

item.title: Beyond the Imitation Game: Quantifying and extrapolating the capabilities of language models
item.description: Accepted to TMLR 2023. How well do large language models perform on an unnatural in-context learning task?

item.title: On the Opportunities and Risks of Foundation Models
item.description: Please cite using these guidelines. endpreamble What are the next steps in teaching foundation models formal reasoning and using them?
